name: post
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: letters, etc. that are delivered to homes or places of work

example.eg: I'd been away for a few days so I had a lot of post waiting for me.
example.egtrans: 我离开了几天，所以有好多信件等着我处理。

example.eg: My secretary usually opens my post, unless it's marked "private".
example.egtrans: 除非写有“亲启”，否则通常由我的秘书来拆我的信件。

example.eg: Has the post come/arrived yet?
example.egtrans: 信件到了吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: the public system that exists for the collecting and delivering of letters

example.eg: My letter must have got lost in the post.
example.egtrans: 我的信肯定在邮递中丢失了。

example.eg: If you don't want to take it there, you can just send it by post.
example.egtrans: 你不想送去的话，可以邮寄。

trans_examp.trans_en: the time during the day when letters, etc. are collected or delivered
trans_examp.trans_cn: 收集（或投递）邮件的时间；邮班

example.eg: I missed the post this morning.
example.egtrans: 我错过了上午的邮班。

example.eg: Did you manage to catch the post?
example.egtrans: 你赶上邮班了吗？

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a job in a company or organization

example.eg: Teaching posts are advertised in Tuesday's edition of the paper.
example.egtrans: 星期二的报纸上有招聘教师的广告。

example.eg: She's held the post for 13 years.
example.egtrans: 她担任该职已有13年之久。

example.eg: They have several vacant posts.
example.egtrans: 他们有几个职位空缺。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a vertical stick or pole stuck into the ground, usually to support something or show a position

example.eg: a lamppost
example.egtrans: 路灯柱

example.eg: a signpost
example.egtrans: 路标

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in the sport of horse racing, the place where the race finishes or, less often, the place from which the race starts
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （赛马的）终点柱，终点标志；起点柱

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in sports such as football, a goalpost (= either of two vertical posts showing the area in which the ball is kicked to score points)

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the particular place where someone works, especially where a soldier is told to be for military duty, usually as a guard

example.eg: The soldier was disciplined for deserting his post.
example.egtrans: 这个士兵因为擅离岗位而受到处分。

example.eg: I was ordered to remain at my post until the last customer had left.
example.egtrans: 我奉命要坚守自己的岗位直到最后一名顾客离开。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something such as a message or picture that you publish on a website or using social media
trans_examp.trans_cn: 网站上公布的信息；帖子

example.eg: Lots of people have commented on my post.
example.egtrans: 许多人给我的帖子加了评论。

example.eg: You can change your privacy settings so that only certain people can see your posts.
example.egtrans: 你可以修改你的隐私设定，只让某些人看到你的帖子。

name: post
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send a letter or parcel by post

example.eg: Did you remember to post my letter?
example.egtrans: 你记得帮我寄信了吗？

example.eg: I must post that parcel (off) or she won't get it in time for her birthday.
example.egtrans: 我得把包裹寄走，否则她过生日就不能及时收到了。

example.eg: Could you post me the details/post the details to me?
example.egtrans: 你能否把详细资料寄给我？

trans_examp.trans_en: to put an object through a letterbox (= special opening in a door)

example.eg: Just post the key through the door after you've locked it.
example.egtrans: 门锁上后就把钥匙从门上的信箱里塞进去。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send someone to a particular place to work

example.eg: He's been posted to Pakistan for six months.
example.egtrans: 他被派到巴基斯坦工作6个月。

example.eg: Guards were posted at all the doors.
example.egtrans: 所有门口处都布置了卫兵。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stick or pin a notice on a wall in order to make it publicly known

example.eg: Company announcements are usually posted (up) on the noticeboard.
example.egtrans: 公司通告通常张贴在布告栏里。

trans_examp.trans_en: to publish something such as a message or picture on a website or using social media
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在网站上）公布，发布（信息）；发（帖）

example.eg: I never post anything on the Internet that I wouldn't want my boss to see.
example.egtrans: 我从来没有在互联网上发布任何我不想让我老板看到的东西。

example.eg: She hardly ever posts on Facebook.
example.egtrans: 她几乎从未在脸书上发消息。

example.eg: Somebody's been posting obscene messages in this chat room.
example.egtrans: 有人一直在这个聊天室里发布淫秽信息。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pay money, especially so that a person who has been accused of committing a crime can be free until their trial

example.eg: She has agreed to post bail for her brother.
example.egtrans: 她已同意为她兄弟支付保释金。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to announce a company's financial results

example.eg: The oil company posted profits of $25.1 billion.
example.egtrans: 石油公司公布利润为251亿美元。

name: post-
posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the beginning of a word to make a new word.

example.eg: postgraduate
example.egtrans: 研究生

example.eg: postoperative
example.egtrans: 手术后的

example.eg: He took a post-lunch nap.
example.egtrans: 他午饭后小睡了一会儿。
